title: LoveWalter
author: LoveWalter
content: Hopefully this is the correct way to get an answer. I’m mining XMR at Mining Pool Hub Pool, and I have no complaints what so ever, actually not even much of a question. But I have my payment threshold to payout around 0.0525 but after 3 days of mining the XMR Payout Estimate never goes over 0.00019000, then it actually goes down to the .00018s, then goes back up to the 00019s then back down. I was just wondering why that is? I’ve mined XMR several times in the past and never had this issue and I was perhaps just wondering if it was something maybe someone else might be noticing to?Anyway, that’s my only questionThanks!

comments.author: Dervish doff
comments.body: it's a good idea to ask the room that discusses all about mining, hopefully they have the right answer for you, if you write here, it's not unanswered, sometimes only a small part knows about mining and other things about mining, but if there all will know your problem, if you look for data about you in other places, I think, even if there is an answer, it is not correct, in my personal opinion, experience is better than theory, once again I say on the mining board for sure you have the solution, here is the link:https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?board=160.0

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: Quote from: LoveWalter on May 17, 2022, 11:13:15 PMAnyway, that’s my only questionThese are preliminary data that the mining pool calculator calculates based on statistics: network difficulty, block rewards, etc.The same as profit in mining calculators, for example on https://whattomine.com/Profit changes slightly every 10-30 minutes, but these are only calculated values.

comments.author: MidNite36
comments.body: It seems you are new to crypto mining, calculators will only give you the present coins you will be making in this minute, things can change in two minutes later or even in a split second, you can make 3$ per day from a GPU today and tomorrow it turns to 2.5$, fluctuations will always happen due to market conditions and mining difficulty.
